data.scheme_name: Revival and Rehabilitation Scheme for Defunct MSMEs and Cashew Processing Units
data.benefits: Scheme provides assistance of upto Rs. 5 lakhs for cashew units.
data.eligibility: All MSMEs in the manufacturing sector that have been defunct for at least 6 months due to genuine issues, including cashew processing enterprises, are eligible for assistance if they can be revived.
data.conditions:
The applicant must provide true details and necessary information. 

The applicant must provide clarifications or additional details if requested by the sanctioning authority. 

The applicant must allow inspection of details, plant, machinery, and assets if needed. 

The applicant must produce original documents like title deeds, ownership certificates, invoices, etc., if required for verification. 

The applicant must sign a legal agreement on Rs. 200 stamp paper when the proposal is approved. The applicant must use the received funds as per the agreed revival project. 

The applicant must operate the unit as per the agreement, or the assistance will be reclaimed under the Kerala Revenue Recovery Act. Bank loan approval for working capital is mandatory.

data.context:
1. The trend in increasing number of defunct units, is a challenge to the secondary sector.
  2. The MSMEs which have become defunct due to genuine issues in the value chain and having potential needs to be revived and rehabilitated considering the role of these units play in the state economy, thus the Government of Kerala launches this new scheme for defunct MSMEs including cashew processing units during 2020-21.
data.objective: The scheme envisages to support defunct MSMEs including cashew processing units through assistance in the form of Capital grants and Working Capital incentives.
data.description: Scheme provides various assistance for revival cashew units: Building Renovation: 25% of total revival project cost, limited to Rs. 2 lakhs Plant & Machinery and Electrification: 40% of total revival project cost, limited to Rs. 8 lakhs Working Capital (Margin)- 50% margin of working Capital loan approved by Financial institution subject to. Assistance limited to Rs.2 lakhs for defunct MSMEs. Assistance limited to Rs.5 lakhs for Cashew Units.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the link : https://industry.kerala.gov.in/index.php/schemes-mainmenu/revival-and-rehabilitation-scheme-for-defunct-msmes-and-cashew-processing-units-schemes
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits after the approval from the concerned authority.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Title deed of land/land tax receipt (if any)
2. Ownership Certificate of building (if any)
3. Registered Lease deed or rent deed in such eases
4. Invoice or bill of Plant and machinery
5. Valuation of Chartered Engineer for civil construction
6. Sanction order of Bank for Working Capital Loan (if any)
7. Other relevant documents (as required)
